00060 typedef struct {
00061         int n; // number of bonds
00062         bond *b; // n of these
00063 } bondset; // set of consecutive bonds
00064 typedef struct {
00065 // See the documentation directory for more information
00066         int ni; // number incoming bonds
00067         molindex *i; // atoms making incoming bonds
00068         int no; // number outgoing bonds
00069         molindex *o; // atoms making outgoing bonds
00070         molindex oref; // index of grandparent incoming atom to use to set torsion
00071         char RS, DL; // for R/S and D/L type chirality
00072         int pm; // for optical activity
00073         char *iso; // other description of isomerism
00074         double *angle; // angles (no + ni - 1)
00075         double *chirot; // chirality rotation (no + ni - 2)
00076         molindex itors; // index of grandparent incoming atom to use to set torsion
00077         double tors; // the torsion angle 
00078         double *distance; // distances (no)
00079 } connection_tree; // for detailed descriptions of

00095 typedef struct {
00096         molindex a,b,c; // three atoms in the angle
00097         double ang; // the angle
00098         angle_type *typ; // pointer to type of angle

00100         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ

00102 typedef struct {
00103         molindex a,b,c,d; // four atoms defining the torsion

00106         char *D;// free-form descriptor
00107         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00108 } torsion_index; // index to atoms in an angle

00110 /********** structure atom *************/
00111 typedef struct {
00112         int n; // atom number or other identifying index
00113         char *N; // atom name 
00114         char *T; // atom type name
00115         char *D; // free-form description
00116         int t; // type number -- must correspond to assignments of "atype" (see)
00117         atype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00118         molindex moli; // the molecule index for this atom (address)
00119         int nb; // number of actual bonds (not expected bonds)
00120         bond *b; // bond structures (nb of these)
00121         int nmb; // number of bonds to other residues or molecules
00122         molbond *mb; // nmb of these
00123         coord_3D x; // atom's coordinates 
00124         int nalt; // number of alternate coordinate sets
00125         coord_3D *xa; // nalt of alternate coords
00126         int nvec; // number of vector sets
00127         vectormag_3D *v; // vector sets
00128         int nch; // number of charges
00129         double *ch; // nch charges for this atom
00130         int ni; // number of other indices
00131         int *i; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00132         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00133         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these) 
00134         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00135         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00136         char *sres; // name of some other/original residue to which this atom belonged
00137         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00138         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00139         int nVP; // number of void structures
00140         char cID; // chain identifier
00141         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00142 } atom; // an actual atom in a residue/molecule
00143 
00144 /********** structure residue *************/
00145 typedef struct {
00146         int n; // residue number given in input file
00147         char *N; // residue name 
00148         char *D; // free-form description for residue
00149         int t; // type number
00150         rtype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00151         molindex moli; // the molecule index for this residue (address -- set .a to -1 or 0) 
00152         int na; // number of atoms in residue
00153         double m; // molecular weight
00154         coord_3D COM; // center of mass for residue
00155         atom *a; // atom structures (na of these)
00156         connection_tree *T; // na of these
00157         int nbs; // number of bond sets 
00158         bondset *bs; // (consecutive bonds, use these for plotting, etc.)
00159         int nr; // number of simple rings (no cage structures, etc.)
00160         int nrbs; // number of ring bondsets defined
00161         bondset *rbs; // bondsets for rings
00162         int nrc; // number of ring/reference coordinate sets defined
00163         coord_3D *rc; // coordinates for ring/reference centers
00164         int nrp; // number of ring planes defined
00165         plane *rp; // equations for average/approximate/exact/etc. ring planes (where useful)
00166         // need something for more complex structures eventually
00167         int ni; // number of other indices
00168         int *i; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00169         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00170         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these)
00171         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00172         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00173         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00174         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00175         int nVP; // number of void structures
00176         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00177 } residue; // an actual residue in a molecule
00178 
00179 /********** structure molecule *************/
00180 typedef struct {
00181         int i; // index
00182         char *N; // free-form name for molecule
00183         char *D; // free-form description for residue
00184         double m; // molecular weight
00185         int Ei; // number corresponding to parent ensemble
00186         int t; // type number
00187         mtype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00188         coord_3D COM; // center of mass for molecule
00189         int na; // total number of atoms in molecule
00190         atom **a; // na of these, but should point into residues
00191         connection_tree *aT; // nat of these
00192         int nr; // number of residues
00193         residue *r; // pointers to residues
00194         connection_tree *rT; // nr of these
00195         int nrb; // number of bonds between residues
00196         molbond *rb; // nrb of these descriptions of bonds 
00197         int nrbs; // number of sets of bonds between residues (for example, linear chains)
00198         molbondset *rbs; // nrbs of these sets
00199         int nrc; // number of additional reference ../inc/molecules.h:265: error: expected specificoordinates (rings, for example)
00200         coord_3D *rc; // nrc of these
00201         int nBOX; 
00202         boxinfo *BOX; 
00203         //coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions
00204         int noi; // number of other indices
00205         int *oi; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00206         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00207         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these)
00208         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00209         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00210         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00211         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00212         int nVP; // number of void structures
00213         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00214 } molecule;

00216 /********** structure dockinfo *************/
00217 typedef struct{
00218         int i; // index
00219         int n; // number of docked structures represented
00220         coord_3D RC, *TR; // reference coordinate ; translation for docked structure
00221         vectormag_3D *Q, *QN, *QN0; // Quaternion x,y,z,w ; Quaternion nx,ny,nz,angle
00222         // NOTE!! do -not- use typical vectormag_3D functions on these structures
00223         int nTors; // Number of Torsions 
00224         double *Tors; // nTors torsions
00225         double *eFEB; // Estimated Free Energy of Binding, kcal/mol [=(1)+(3)]
00226         double *eKi, *Tmp; // Estimated Inhibition Constant, Ki & temperature, Kelvin
00227         double *fDE; // Final Docked Energy, kcal/mol [=(1)+(2)]
00228         double *fIE; // (1) Final Intermolecular Energy   
00229         double *fIEL; // (2) Final Internal Energy of Ligand 
00230         double *TFE; // (3) Torsional Free Energy          
00231         int nDIH; // number of dihedrals
00232         double *DIH; // the dihedrals
00233         molecule M; // to hold molecule info about the initial/docked structures
00234 } dockinfo;

00236 /********** structure assembly *************/
00237 typedef struct { // structure for groups of molecules within a larger structure
00238         int i; // index
00239         char *N; // name
00240         char *D; // description (free-form) (was *desc)
00241         double mass; // mass of assembly
00242         coord_3D COM; // center of mass 
00243         int nm; // number of molecule structures
00244         molecule **m; // nm of these
00245         connection_tree *mT; // nm of these
00246         //int nmb; // number of bonds/connections between molecules (H-bonds, for example)
00247         //molbond *mb; // nmb of these descriptions of connection 
00248         int nr; // number of residues
00249         residue **r; // nr of these -- probably best to point into molecules...
00250         connection_tree *rT; // nr of these
00251         int na; // number of atoms
00252         atom **a; // na of these -- probably best to point into mol/res combos
00253         int naT; // naT connection trees defined.
00254         connection_tree *aT; // naT of these
00255         int nb; // total number of bonds
00256         molbond *b; // the bonds
00257         int nANG; // # of angles
00258         angle_index *ANG; // nANG of these
00259         int nTOR; // # of torsions
00260         torsion_index *TOR; // nTOR of these
00261         int nPRM; // number of parameter sets
00262         parameter_set *PRM; // pointer to parameter sets
00263         int nmbs; // number of sets of connections between molecules 
00264         molbondset *mbs; // nmbs of these sets
00265         int nBOX; 
00266         boxinfo *BOX; 
00267         //coord_3D boxl,boxh; // simple box dimensions (limits low & high or just use one for size)
00268         //double boxang; // coord_3D is x, y and z -- angle (probably between XY and YZ planes in degrees, maybe).  
00269         //char *boxtype; // type of simple box (cubic, trapezoidal, etc.)
00270         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00271         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00272         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00273         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00274         int nVP; // number of void pointers
00275         void *VP; // void pointers
00276 } assembly;

00279 typedef struct { // structure for an entire system of molecules

00281         char *N; // name
00282         char *D; // free-form descriptor

00284         coord_3D COM; // center of mass

00286         molecule *m; // nm of these
00287         int na; // number of assembly structures
00288         assembly *a; // na of these
00289         int nBOX; 
00290         boxinfo *BOX; 
00291         //coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions
00292         int nPRM; // number of parameter sets
00293         parameter_set *PRM; // pointer to parameter sets
00294         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00295         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors

00297         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00298         int nVP; // number of void pointers
00299         void *VP; // void pointers
00300 } ensemble;

00302 /* The following is a set of functions intended primarily to facilitate 
00303 debugging.  But, they could easily be used for verbose data output within
00304 the program.  They all follow the same basic format:
00305 
00306 print_X(X *x, int level)
00307 
00308 where   X = one of the structures defined above (e.g., molecule, residue, 
00309                 bondset, atom, bond, atype, plane, vectormag_3D, coord_3D).
00310         *x = pointer to your structure
00311         level = the depth to print.  This is only available on structures 
00312                 likely to contain arrays of other structures.  level=0 only
00313                 prints the top-level information.  level=1 prints one level 
00314                 down of other structures, lists, etc. level=2 prints two 
00315                 levels down, etc.   The value of level can be larger than 
00316                 the depth available -- the function will stop when it runs
00317                 out of structures to print.  
00318 */
00319 int NUMAT; 
00320 void print_molecule(molecule*,int),print_residue(residue*,int);
00321 void print_bondset(bondset*,int),print_atom(atom*,int),print_bond(bond*);
00322 void print_atype(atype*,int),print_plane(plane*);
00323 void print_vectormag_3D(vectormag_3D*),print_coord_3D(coord_3D*);

00325 void dprint_molecule(molecule*,int),dprint_residue(residue*,int);
00326 void dprint_bondset(bondset*,int),dprint_atom(atom*,int),dprint_bond(bond*);
00327 void dprint_atype(atype*,int),dprint_plane(plane*);
00328 void dprint_vectormag_3D(vectormag_3D*),dprint_coord_3D(coord_3D*);
00329 //
00330 void dXprint_molecule(molecule*,int),dXprint_residue(residue*,int);
00331 void dXprint_bondset(bondset*,int),dXprint_atom(atom*,int),dXprint_bond(bond*);
00332 void dXprint_atype(atype*,int),dXprint_plane(plane*);
00333 void dXprint_vectormag_3D(vectormag_3D*),dXprint_coord_3D(coord_3D*);

00335 /* the following are geometric operations for the structures defined above 
00336         where int is xl ("x" (coordinate) location):
00337                 xl refers to position in the atom structure
00338                         xl=-1 means use the atom.x structure
00339                         xl=0,1,2,etc means use the atom.xa[xl] or
00340                                 the atom.v[xl] structure
00341         where int,int is "xl,vl" it refers to coord and vector location
00342                 (in that order).
00343         where int is n
00344                 n indicates the number of blocks in the preceding pointer
00345 
00346    All of the following that involve vectors will set the magnitude of 
00347         the resulting vector without relying on the entry in the input 
00348         vector.  So, for example, there is no need to get_magnitude 
00349         before normalizing or multiplying by a scalar.
00350 */
00351 /* this moves all the coords in molecule so that the center of mass
00352 for the molecule is at the origin (right now, though, it only works
00353 if the molecule has only one residue...*/
00354 void translate_to_COM(molecule *,atype *,int); // int is xl
00355         // this assumes the initial coords are in atom.x
00356 //void translate_zero_to_COM(molecule *,atype *,int,int); 
00357         // int#1 is xs, the location of the source coords
00358         // int#2 is xt, the location of the translated coords
00359 void translate_zero_to_coord_M(molecule *,int,int,coord_3D); 
00360         // int#1 is xs, the location of the source coords
00361         // int#2 is xt, the location of the translated coords
00362 void assign_residue_COM(residue *r,atype *ATYPE);
00363 void assign_molecule_COM(molecule *m,atype *ATYPE);
00364 void assign_assembly_COM(assembly *a,atype *ATYPE);
00365 void assign_ensemble_COM(ensemble *e,atype *ATYPE);
00366 coord_3D get_residue_COM(residue *r,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00367 coord_3D get_molecule_COM(molecule *m,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00368 coord_3D get_assembly_COM(assembly *a,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00369 coord_3D get_ensemble_COM(ensemble *e,atype *ATYPE,int xs);

00371 /* the following functions rotate the coordinate list such that the
00372 vector given by vectormag_3D points along the Z (Y, X, other) axis.
00373 The orientation of the orthogonal axes is arbitrary. */
00374 void rotate_vector_to_Z_M(molecule*,int,int,int,int,vectormag_3D); 
00375         // The four integers are:
00376         // int#1 location of source coordinates (-1=x, 0,1,2,etc=xa[xs]
00377         // int#2 location of rotated coordinates (-1=x, 0,1,2,etc=xa[xs]
00378         // int#3 location of source vectors (-1=do not calc, 0,1,2,etc=v[xs]
00379         // int#4 location of rotated vectors (-1=do not calc, 0,1,2,etc=v[xs]
00380 void rotate_vector_to_Z_list(coord_3D*,int,vectormag_3D); // int is n
